attractions.name: Eiffel Tower
attractions.description: Iconic iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars, offering panoramic views of Paris.

attractions.name: Louvre Museum
attractions.description: World’s largest art museum and home to masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and The Venus de Milo.

attractions.name: Montmartre
attractions.description: Artistic hilltop district known for its bohemian history, street artists, and Sacré-Cœur Basilica.

attractions.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
attractions.description: Gothic masterpiece on Île de la Cité, currently under restoration but still impressive.

restaurants.name: Le Marais
restaurants.must_try: Duck confit with red wine sauce

tips: Buy a Paris Museum Pass for unlimited access and skip-the-line entry.
Use the Metro — it's fast, cheap, and covers all major attractions.
Visit the Eiffel Tower at night to see the sparkling light show every hour.

3-day: Day 1: Eiffel Tower → Seine River Cruise → Champs-Élysées → Arc de Triomphe
Day 2: Louvre Museum → Tuileries Garden → Notre-Dame → Sainte-Chapelle
Day 3: Montmartre → Sacré-Cœur → Moulin Rouge → Dinner in Le Marais
1-day: Evening: Seine Cruise → Eiffel Tower (night view)

attractions.name: Senso-ji Temple
attractions.description: Tokyo’s oldest temple located in Asakusa, known for its giant lantern and bustling Nakamise shopping street.

attractions.name: Shibuya Crossing
attractions.description: World’s busiest pedestrian scramble, iconic in films and media.

attractions.name: Meiji Shrine
attractions.description: Serene Shinto shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji, surrounded by a lush forest in Shibuya.

attractions.name: Tokyo Skytree
attractions.description: Towering observation deck with panoramic views of Tokyo and Mount Fuji on clear days.

tips: Get a Suica or Pasmo card for seamless travel on trains and buses.
Reserve high-end restaurants like Sukiyabashi Jiro weeks in advance.
Avoid rush hour (8–9:30 AM) on trains — it gets extremely crowded.

3-day: Day 1: Meiji Shrine → Harajuku (Takeshita Street) → Shibuya Crossing → Hachiko Statue
Day 2: Asakusa (Senso-ji) → Tokyo Skytree → Sumida River Cruise
Day 3: Tsukiji Outer Market → Odaiba (teamLab Planets) → Robot Restaurant
1-day: Morning: Meiji Shrine → Harajuku → Shibuya Crossing
